text: Josiah Bartlett (November 21, 1729â€“ May 19, 1795), was an American physician and statesman, delegate to the Continental Congress for New Hampshire. He signed the Declaration of Independence. He was later Chief Justice of the New Hampshire Superior Court of Judicature and governor of the state. title: Josiah Bartlett
